oracle.spatial.rdf.client.jena

Class OracleGraphWrapperForOntModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.jena.graph.impl.GraphBase
      • oracle.spatial.rdf.client.jena.OracleGraphWrapperForOntModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.apache.jena.graph.Graph, org.apache.jena.graph.impl.GraphWithPerform

    public class OracleGraphWrapperForOntModel
extends org.apache.jena.graph.impl.GraphBase
implements org.apache.jena.graph.Graph
    Represents a graph backed by an Oracle RDF/OWL/SKOS model in an Oracle semantic store that is meant to be used in conjunction with Jena's OntModel. Jena's OntModel provides a rich API for creating, updating, and analyzing ontologies. For best performance, create all Oracle backed OntModel models using this class instead of GraphOracleSem.

    Since Jena's OntModel implementation is not optimized for a relational database, some of the OntModel APIs perform suboptimal on the Oracle database. To alleviate this problem, this graph uses two semantic stores in a hybrid approach when constructing an OntModel. Both stores contain the same data, but one resides in memory while the other resides in the Oracle database. When queries are made through the OntModel, the queries will run against the in-memory store to cut network round trip time and improve performance. However, changes made to the OntModel, such as adding or removing classes, will apply to both stores.

    Due to the hybrid approach used by this graph, creating an OntModel requires sufficient memory be allocated to the JVM to store a copy of the ontology in memory. Additionally, the OntModel returned by this class will not reflect changes made to the underlying Oracle database by another process, through a separate OntModel, or through a separate Oracle graph referencing the same underlying model. In other words, all changes to the ontology should go through the OntModel using this graph or through this graph directly until the graph or OntModel is closed.

    This graph will create a new (separate) in-memory copy of an ontology for every instance. This factory does not share in-memory copies of ontologies even if the graphs reference the same underlying Oracle model.

    Since:
    Nov. 2011

    • Method Detail

      • close

        public void close()
        This method closes both the Oracle graph (i.e. the GraphOracleSem object) and the querying graph specified in the getInstance method used to create this graph.

        This method will commit the Oracle transaction when closing the Oracle graph.

        Specified by:
        close in interface org.apache.jena.graph.Graph
        Overrides:
        close in class org.apache.jena.graph.impl.GraphBase

      • getBulkUpdateHandler

        public OracleBulkUpdateHandler getBulkUpdateHandler()
        Returns an instance of OracleBulkUpdateHandler upon request. A new instance will be created on the first call.

      • getInMemoryGraph

        public org.apache.jena.graph.impl.GraphBase getInMemoryGraph()
        Returns the querying graph used by this graph for answering queries quickly. The querying graph is used to improve performance of many of Jena's OntModel APIs.
        Returns:
        querying graph used to improve query performance

      • getInstance

        public static OracleGraphWrapperForOntModel getInstance(GraphOracleSem oracleGraph)
        Returns an instance of OracleGraphWrapperForOntModel that uses the specified Oracle graph, oracleGraph, and an in-memory querying graph in a hybrid fashion optimized for use in OntModel.

        Large ontologies (Oracle graphs) may require adjusting the JVM memory properties since this method creates a graph that uses an in-memory querying graph. The in-memory querying graph provides quick query responses at the expense of memory. If experiencing slow queries, ensure the system has sufficient main memory and is not paging JVM memory.

        Closing the Oracle graph, oracleGraph, will prevent use of the OracleGraphWrapperForOntModel graph returned by this method. Note that this class's close() method will close both the Oracle graph and the querying graph.

        Parameters:
        oracleGraph - base Oracle graph object that is responsible for persisting changes made to this graph instance
        Returns:
        graph backed by the specified Oracle graph and optimized for use in OntModel
        See Also:
        getInstance(GraphOracleSem,GraphBase), getInstance(GraphOracleSem,GraphBase,int)

      • getInstance

        public static OracleGraphWrapperForOntModel getInstance(GraphOracleSem oracleGraph,
                                                        org.apache.jena.graph.impl.GraphBase queryGraph)
        Returns an instance of OracleGraphWrapperForOntModel that uses the specified Oracle graph, oracleGraph, and querying graph, queryGraph, in a hybrid fashion optimized for use in OntModel. Be careful using this method as it may produce incorrect results if the querying graph contains data not present in the Oracle graph! It is recommended, although not necessary, that the querying graph, queryGraph, be empty.

        For best performance, we recommend the querying graph to be in-memory.

        This method requires that the querying graph not contain any data not present in the Oracle graph. In other words, the querying graph should only contain a subset of the data found in the Oracle graph. Ideally, the querying graph should be empty. If uncertain about the data in querying graph, either clear the querying graph of all data or use the getInstance(GraphOracleSem) instead.

        Closing the Oracle graph, oracleGraph, will prevent use of the OracleGraphWrapperForOntModel graph returned by this method. Note that this class's close() method will close both the Oracle graph and the querying graph.

        Parameters:
        oracleGraph - base Oracle graph object that is responsible for persisting changes made to this Graph instance.
        queryGraph - graph used to hold a copy of the Oracle graph and changes and to serve query requests quickly
        Returns:
        graph backed by the specified Oracle graph and optimized for use in OntModel
        See Also:
        getInstance(GraphOracleSem), getInstance(GraphOracleSem,GraphBase,int)

      • getInstance

        public static OracleGraphWrapperForOntModel getInstance(GraphOracleSem oracleGraph,
                                                        org.apache.jena.graph.impl.GraphBase queryGraph,
                                                        int dop)
        Returns an instance of OracleGraphWrapperForOntModel that uses the specified Oracle graph, oracleGraph, and querying graph, queryGraph, in a hybrid fashion optimized for use in OntModel. Be careful using this method as it may produce incorrect results if the querying graph contains data not present in the Oracle graph! It is recommended, although not necessary, that the querying graph, queryGraph, be empty.

        For best performance, we recommend the querying graph to be in-memory.

        This method requires that the querying graph not contain any data not present in the Oracle graph. In other words, the querying graph should only contain a subset of the data found in the Oracle graph. Ideally, the querying graph should be empty. If uncertain about the data in querying graph, either clear the querying graph of all data or use the getInstance(GraphOracleSem) instead.

        Closing the Oracle graph, oracleGraph, will prevent use of the OracleGraphWrapperForOntModel graph returned by this method. Note that this class's close() method will close both the Oracle graph and the querying graph.

        Parameters:
        oracleGraph - base Oracle graph object that is responsible for persisting changes made to this Graph instance.
        queryGraph - graph used to hold a copy of the Oracle graph and changes and to serve query requests quickly
        dop - degree of parallelism used to copy all triples from the Oracle graph into the querying graph
        Returns:
        graph backed by the specified Oracle graph and optimized for use in OntModel
        See Also:
        getInstance(GraphOracleSem), getInstance(GraphOracleSem,GraphBase)

      • getOracleGraph

        public GraphOracleSem getOracleGraph()
        Returns the Oracle graph that persists changes made to this graph in an underlying Oracle RDF/OWL/SKOS model in the Oracle semantic store.
        Returns:
        Oracle graph that persists all changes made to this graph within an Oracle semantic store

      • performAdd

        public void performAdd(org.apache.jena.graph.Triple t)
        Adds a triple into the graph. This change to this graph object will not be persisted until the transaction is committed. However, subsequent queries using this graph can see this change.

      • performDelete

        public void performDelete(org.apache.jena.graph.Triple t)
